permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: key
params.doc:
Field key.
Automatically generated from the namespace and display name.
Formatted as `namespace.display-name-slug`.

docs.summary:
Deletes an extended field.

<!--ONLY:VELO
The `deleteExtendedField()` function returns a Promise that resolves
when the requested extended field is deleted.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

When an extended field is deleted,
any contact data stored in the field is permanently deleted as well.

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: displayName
params.doc:
Human-readable name to find or create.

 If an existing field is an exact match
 for the requested display name,
 the existing field is returned.
 If not, a new field is created and returned.

params.name: dataType
params.doc:
Type of data the field holds.
Ignored if an existing field is an exact match
for the requested display name.

<!--ONLY:REST-->
- `TEXT` and `URL` both accept strings.
- `DATE` accepts dates formatted as `"YYYY-MM-DD"`.
- `NUMBER` accepts integers. For decimals, use type `TEXT`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:

- `"TEXT"`: Accepts strings.
- `"URL"`: Accepts strings.
- `"DATE"`: Accepts dates formatted as `"YYYY-MM-DD"`.
- `"NUMBER"`: Accepts integers. For decimals, use type `"TEXT"`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

ret.doc: Extended field that was found or created.

docs.summary:
Retrieves an extended field with a given name, or creates one if it doesn't exist.

<!--ONLY:REST-->
Successful calls to this endpoint always return a field,
which can be passed to subsequent requests.

To find an existing extended field without potentially creating a new one, use
[Get Extended Field](https:dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/extended-fields/get-extended-field) or
[List Extended Fields](https:dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/extended-fields/list-extended-fields).
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
The `findOrCreateExtendedField()` function returns a Promise
that resolves when the requested extended field is found or created.

Successful calls to `findOrCreateExtendedField()` always return a field,
which can be passed to subsequent function calls.

To find an existing extended field without potentially creating a new one, use
[`getExtendedField()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/getextendedfield) or
[`listExtendedFields()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/listextendedfields).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: key
params.doc:
Field key.
Automatically generated from the namespace and display name.
Formatted as `namespace.display-name-slug`.

<!--ONLY:REST-->
When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `info.extendedFields.items[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `info.extendedFields.items["custom.patronus"]`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `extendedFields[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `extendedfields["custom.patronus"]`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

Once set, `key` cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

docs.summary:
Retrieves an extended field.

<!--ONLY:VELO
The `getExtendedField()` function returns a Promise
that resolves when the extended field is retrieved.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: fieldType
params.doc: Filter for fields of the specified type.

params.name: namespace
params.doc: Filter for fields in the specified namespace.

params.name: startsWith
params.doc: Filter for fields where `displayName` starts with the specified case-sensitive string.

params.name: sort.fieldName
params.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

params.name: sort.order
params.doc:
Sort order.

<!--ONLY:REST-->
- `ASC`: Ascending order
- `DESC`: Descending order.

Defaults to `ASC`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:

- `"ASC"`: Ascending order
- `"DESC"`: Descending order

Defaults to `"ASC"`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

params.name: paging.limit
params.doc:
Number of items to return.

 Defaults to `100`.

params.name: paging.offset
params.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

docs.summary: Retrieves extended fields, given the provided filtering, paging, and sorting.

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: field.key
params.doc:
Field key.
Automatically generated from the namespace and display name.
Formatted as `namespace.display-name-slug`.

<!--ONLY:REST-->
When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `info.extendedFields.items[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `info.extendedFields.items["custom.patronus"]`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `extendedFields[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `extendedfields["custom.patronus"]`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

Once set, `key` cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

docs.summary:
<!--ONLY:VELO Renames an extended field.

The `renameExtendedField()` function returns a Promise
that resolves when the requested extended field is renamed.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

<!--ONLY:REST-->
Updates an extended field's specified properties.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

messages.displayName: Extended Field Entity Deleted Event Object

members.name: namespace
members.doc:
Field namespace.
Field keys must be unique within a given namespace.

Fields created by site contributors or third party apps
are automatically assigned to the `custom` namespace.

members.name: key
members.doc:
Field key.
Automatically generated from the namespace and display name.
Formatted as `namespace.display-name-slug`.

<!--ONLY:REST-->
When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `info.extendedFields.items[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `info.extendedFields.items["custom.patronus"]`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `extendedFields[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `extendedfields["custom.patronus"]`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

Once set, `key` cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

members.name: dataType
members.doc:
Type of data the field holds.

<!--ONLY:REST-->
- `TEXT` and `URL` both accept strings.
- `DATE` accepts dates formatted as `"YYYY-MM-DD"`.
- `NUMBER` accepts integers. For decimals, use type `TEXT`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:

- `"TEXT"`: Accepts strings.
- `"URL"`: Accepts strings.
- `"DATE"`: Accepts dates formatted as `"YYYY-MM-DD"`.
- `"NUMBER"`: Accepts integers. For decimals, use type `"TEXT"`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: fieldType
members.doc: Details about the app that created the field.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the field was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time field was updated.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to return.

 Defaults to `100`.

members.name: offset
members.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

members.name: total
members.doc: Number of items that matched the query.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc:
Indicates if `total` calculation timed out before the response was sent.
 Typically this happens if there is a large set of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc:
Sort order.

<!--ONLY:REST-->
- `ASC`: Ascending order
- `DESC`: Descending order.

Defaults to `ASC`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:

- `"ASC"`: Ascending order
- `"DESC"`: Descending order

Defaults to `"ASC"`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]
 Currently supports sorting on one field only.

 If an existing field is an exact match

 If not, a new field is created and returned.

Ignored if an existing field is an exact match

<!--ONLY:REST-->
- `TEXT` and `URL` both accept strings.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_contacts_fields_v4_FindOrCreateExtendedFieldResponse

docs.summary: Extended field that was found or created.

members.name: field
members.doc: Extended field that was found or created.

members.name: newField
members.doc:
Indicates whether the extended field was just created or already existed.

 If the field was just created, returns `true`.
 If it already existed, returns `false`.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_DATA_TYPE
  • TEXT
  • NUMBER
  • DATE
  • URL

  • UNKNOWN
  • SYSTEM
  • USER_DEFINED
